ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This course is amazing. It's so perfect for anyone interested in doing research. The only problem is that there are so many students for Mark and Elaine to handle, and I'm sure it's overwhelming. There should be other professors teaching this course too! The support is so vital for the successful completion of our research.

Excellent TF. Elaine was very helpful and knowledgeable and gave us a huge amount of her time. Her workshops on statistics were very clear and well organized, and overall show that she is a great teacher.
This is a perfect class for students planning on publishing their research!
Question 7: Both the professor and TA were very responsive to questions and I give them great credit fordoing twice as much work given the number of students.

Question 10. Its valuable to students who did summer research and came back with data that might not be in good shape. This class helps you organize your research with the help of both the Professor and TA to write out a manuscript fit for publication. So for students like me this is a class that disciplines and helps you to write your masters thesis on time.
The relaxed atmosphere, the motivation to move forward on research, the opportunity for comments from peers and other experts, the general morale boost offered from the group. And the pizza!

I was so thankful for this course this fall! Dr. Ashton creates a supportive and collegial environment. I really enjoyed the paper critique assignments - this is a crucial skill and Dr. Ashton is great at teaching it. I also really enjoyed the chance to develop my skills in giving constructive feedback to my classmates. By offering this course, Dr. Ashton is providing a CRUCIAL service to 2nd-year students, and he is amazing at combining true skill development with a wonderful sense of humor. He keeps us working hard, he keeps things positive, and he gives great feedback.
Mark and Elaine! No matter how many students they have or even if they're sick with the flu, they always give 300%. They genuinely care so much.
Making progress on my thesis while getting very valuable feedback from students and instructors.
Working in depth on my research.
It is geared toward helping student succeed with their own projects - instead of taking independent study, the collaborative environment in this course was invaluable.
To end with half my research paper done.

How we get feed backs on various sections of our manuscript not only from the instructor and TA but also form our colleagues. We also learn how to critique other papers and learn from mistakes and the good things about other manuscripts to inform our own.
The push to move forward on your thesis as part of the class - giving me more accountability.
It really helped me keep a good pace with developing my own thesis/reserach.
Practicing our formal presentations and keeping us on track for publishing in the spring. The class is a great support network for students trying to synthesize their summer research!
The chance to present your work to group of people with a diversity of interests.

Really incredible dedication from Mark, how he made a second section just to make sure everybody could be included in the course who wanted to take it. It shows that a course like this is in great demand at FES and needs to be promoted. Perhaps would be most ideal to have a natural science and a social science version so that people could get valuable feedback from peers in the same field.
Peer (classmates, instructor and TA) review and comments on the writing work and presentations.
if you want to publish a paper, even if you're not yet convinced your data is suitable, this is the course to take

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: I wonder whether we maybe should analyze the results before we write the introduction - because what we find in our results will have a large influence on the angle we take in the introduction?
We need more professors teaching this so Mark and Elaine aren't so over-committed.
none
Doing busy work of other assignments outside of my research.

More people caught on than just Mark Ashton's MFS students. It's too big now. I wonder if there might be a social ecologist who could offer something similar so that those students would also have a group to work with?
This class should have another professor and/or TA, potentially splitting social and natural science (though it is helpful to have options for the class time).
I wish the prof would keep time better (if presenters are given 8 minutes, don't let them speak for 15).
It would be great to do more small group work-shopping of presentations and papers.

Students should be split up according to their interests during the weekly classes. I know Mark wanted more people in the Tuesday section vs. Wednesday section, but I think perhaps this should have been split up more thematically as opposed to who was simply available which day (although I know this is hard to do).
n/a

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: High quality help and often available.
Dr. Ashton and Elaine gave very helpful feedback and were amazingly available, considering how overenrolled the course was!
AMAZING! They always make time for you, even though their lives are totally crazy with busyness. And their advice is always helpful too.
Excellent
Excellent.
The help and guidance from the instructor and the TA was indispensable.
Very good.
They were both very helpful in given us feedback all the time.
Great.
Great.
All students received exceptional individual feedback from the instructor and TA. This included all in-class presentations as well as course submissions.
They were both more than accommodating.
the TA (Elaine) was super available. Mark is available, but extremely busy

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Very helpful course to help me through the challenging process of processing, analyzing, and writing about research. I wish that FES had a similar class to guide us through the first year and developing our research (kind of like research methods but extended through the spring!)
Capstone.
Perfectly! I can't imagine doing my MESc without it.
This course is allowing me to produce a high quality report of my research findings to submit for publication
It helps me with my masters thesis.
As a MFS, my goal is get my research fit for publication; this course did more to help me on that road than any other course at FES could do.
This course helped me with my masters thesis and also because of it I may be able to publish my work once its complete.
Really helped me develop my own research/thesis.
This course provides a synthesis of the peer-review and research process. It gives structure and support to MESc and MFS students trying to publish and present their work.
Helps me analyze my summer research data, gives me a forum and support from other students to see where I fit in.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: In order to structure the process of writing up a research project, and in order to be part of a community of students who were working through the same thing.
I need some help making sure my research progresses as it should.
To assist in writing my thesis
It helps me with my masters thesis and gave me credits to work on it.
Because I needed to start writing my final research paper, and this course helps you with that.
To help me get my masters thesis written out and on to publication.
To make sure that I stay on track and get the support I need to publish and present my MESc research.
To improve my presentation and writing skills.
i wanted to publish my summer research results

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes!
It exceeded my expectations!
Exceeded my expectations!
Yes
Yes.
YES.
Yes, it did.
Yes it did.
yes
Absolutely, and I look forward to the spring.
Absolutely.

For the most part yes, although the class ended up being too large to really get the most out of it, because so much time was dedicated to listening to other presentations, which may not be thematically similar to a student's project. This isn't Mark's fault, but maybe he should be willing to limit the class size more strictly, even if it means some students will have to go elsewhere for help, since it may in the long run be better to limit the class the those who will get the most out of it.
Yes, absolutely.
yes

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes!
Yes!
Yes
Yes.
YES.
Yes, I did.
Yes I did
Yes. It's been a huge help to move forward on my thesis.
So far so good.
Yes, I did.
yes. although i was surprised by just how much time would be dedicated towards interpreting results

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: More peer feedback.
We worked in small groups to peer-review each other's papers. I thought it was really helpful, because my peers came up with comments and suggestions that Mark and Elaine missed.
It was helpful to get other people's perspectives on your paper.
It was great to have detailed feedback from other students.

Getting feedback from peers in small groups is extremely helpful. Many of us get so absorbed in our work that we don't realize we're forgetting chunks of material from our literature reviews, or that we need to clarify concepts that seem really straightforward to us after working in a specific context for so long.
Peer review and comments in the group are really helpful.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Do it!! It's amazing.
Put in time throughout the semester...it will help you down the road.
If you are an MFS or have research you hope to whip into publishable shape, this course is a MUST.
Your work will be criticized and you probably will criticize others too, but in doing so you will learn and your research will be a great one because of that.
Get ahead on your thesis because when the semester gets busy it's going to be hard.
Talk to the instructor and get feedback from peers as much as possible.

Evaluate whether you will be able to share enough subject matter with your peers to get the most out of the course. If your topic is too different from the others it may be harder to stay engaged and offer/receive enough useful advice during the semester.However, getting feedback on presentations is one of the most useful aspects of this course.
if you want/need to publish a paper, take the course. it is well-paced, and it will help you improve your public speaking skills.
